Generation I.Red: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pok é mon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pok é mon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
Generation I.Yellow: A mild-mannered Pok é mon that does not like to fight. Beware, its small horns secrete venom.
Generation I.Stadium: Although small, it should be treated with caution because of its highly toxic thorns. The female has a small horn.

Generation II.Gold: The poison hidden in its small horn is extremely potent. Even a tiny scratch can have fatal results.
Generation II.Silver: Although not very combative, it will torment its foes with poison spikes if it is threatened in any way.
Generation II.Crystal: Small and very docile, it protects itself with its small, poisonous horn when attacked.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The poison hidden in its small horn is extremely potent. Even a tiny scratch can have fatal results. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Although not very combative, it will torment its foes with poison spikes if it is threatened in any way. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Nidoran has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pok é mon . When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
Generation III.Sapphire: Nidoran has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pok é mon . When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
Generation III.Emerald: Its highly toxic barbs are thought to have developed as protection for this small- bodied Pok é mon . When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
Generation III.FireRed: Though small, it must be treated with caution because of its powerfully toxic barbs. The female has smaller horns.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.

Generation VIII.Sword: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they'll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
Generation VIII.Shield: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: While this Pokémon does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the venom it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: While this Pokémon does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the venom it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.
